Posts.Content: mimi46 wrote: Does anyone have a recommendation for a good breast cancer surgeon in the Seattle/Bellevue area?  I was diagnosed in late May with breast cancer (Estrogen negative, her2+) & my surgeon is unfortunately unable to operate on me until July.  I just don't feel safe waiting until then, as have been told I'll need chemo & radiation & the only bright spot is that (as far as the docs can tell!) my tumor is relatively small.  Does Swedish Hospital have a good breast cancer surgery reputation?  If anyone has a recommendation for me, it would be most gratefully accepted!  Many thanks & best wishes for excellent outcomes to us all!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help!! GOOD BREAST CANCER SURGEON IN SEATTLE ANYONE? mimi46 golfer779

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 03:25PM mimi46 wrote: SWEDISH HOSPITAL turned out to be perfect for me - just in case anyone else in Seattle is in quandary as I was.  I was seen quickly by a breast cancer surgeon there & had my lumpectomy & nodes biopsy less than a week after my first appt.  Everyone at Swedish treated me very well & the experience was so much easier than I'd expected.
